description:
Awesome pad-thai and fried rice.
Not fancy at all and not the most modern interior. But i would say it is a very very good choice if you want a low key, delicious home style thai food. 
Beef fried rice was neither too oily nor dry! I love it when my friends take out food and stop by :) they have a clean plastic box for take out which is great. pad see yoo was also tasty, but personally the catfish was not as impressive.
I wish more people get to enjoy chili lemon garlic.
author: Eli K.

description:
Do not order from this restaurant. I placed an order online and when I got to the restaurant to pick it up, they didn't honor my order because the prices online didn't reflect the price on their in restaurant menu. 

Cancelled my order without giving me a heads up. They could've called me to tell me my order was cancelled or something. 

Drove 20 minutes to pick it up only to find out the order was cancelled without consent. 40 minute round trip for nothing. 

Terrible customer service. Go elsewhere.
author: Samson L.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE. 

Waited 40 minutes for our TO GO oder. There was only one server and one cook working. Service was incredibly slow.

Once I received my order and sat down at my office to eat, there was a LONG BLACK HAIR in my soup. 

Needless to say disgusting, and after waiting over an hour for my lunch, I ended up tossing it in the garbage. 

GROSS.
author: MalLabel M.

description: Great portion size. Good flavor. I got a green curry with tofu and rice. Low on spice level than what I prefer but the hot sauce condiment they provided compensated for it.
author: Sushma R.

description: I would give zero stars if I could because I have never been to a restaurant that does not want to give business to paying customers. I placed an order online, was given notification that my order would be ready in 10-12 minutes, and proceeded to make my way to pick up my dinner. When I got there, I was told that my order was cancelled because the menu prices online did not reflect the actual menu price in the restaurant. Complete waste of my time.
author: Michelle C.

description: There are limited number of Restaurants open for dinner on weekend nights in soma by the ball park when there is not a game. This is one of them.  This is a mom and pop little restaurant that makes ok food. Ozone Thai is a bit better but this place is ok for Thai when you're hungry. Use an app to pre-order your meal because they usually only have 1 cook so it takes a long time for take out.
author: R T.

description: I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and Thai Boat Noodle Soup, and I have to say... it's not the best Thai food I've ever had, BUT it was satisfying for my craving.  It would've been a solid three stars for me, but dude, delivery to my place was lightning fast through the Yelp app and I had to do a solid plus one star for that.  I know restaurants can't really control how fast delivery happens, but props to you Chili Lemon Garlic for whipping up my dinner quickly!  I placed my order around 7:20 pm, confirmed less than 5 minutes later, and received my delivery by 7:55 pm even though the estimated wait time was 45 - 60 minutes!  Yo, I think I'm gonna have to do delivery from here more often especially since I have zero Thai restaurants within walking distance from me.  I'm a fan!
author: Carena N.

description: Solid home style Thai food in China Basin. I love the Pad See Ew especially! My go-to when I am working. Decent portions, tasty food.
author: Rich S.

description:
Here for a casual weekday dinner with friend. 

Empty every time I pass by this restaurant so I was a little skeptical at first, but it turned out to be okay. Quiet casual thai restaurant, decent service.

We had the pad see ew (4 stars) and pumpkin curry (4.5 stars) and both were great despite the small portion sizes. I especially liked the pumpkin curry - very rich and flavorful! There are definitely better thai options in the neighborhood but this place pass the bar for decent thai food.

TLDR: good spot for a quick weekday dinner
author: Nancy Z.

description:
I've used meal pal 3 times at this location. All three times the food was not ready during the given time. In fact they didn't start the order until I got there and that's actually when it's supposed to be ready. Food is good but service is terrible. 

Don't use meal pal at this restaurant. The focal point of meal pal is to make picking up lunch a quick process.
author: Iyahman R.

description:
I tried ordering from this place through Doordash and apparently there was something wrong with their system and they never got my order. The delivery driver showed up to the restaurant and calls me to tell me that she can't delivery my food because they refused to make my order. Even after talking to me, they asked me to contact Doordash so they could confirm my order. Instead of wasting minutes trying to contact me, the restaurant could and should have contacted Doordash directly to confirm my order. They didn't and I was without lunch for the day. Their ineptitude lost them a potential repeat customer, hopefully this review resonates with you and you decide to go elsewhere.

UPDATE: Here's my response to the owner's comment for transparency: 

I ordered through doordash and the driver was sent to pick the order up just as I have hundreds of times before. When the driver showed up, your restaurant claimed there was no order made and that I cancelled it. The driver called me to confirm the order and I spoke to your staff and they wanted me to call Doordash to confirm my order. Your system had the problem because it apparently didn't receive the order. Why should a customer call to report an issue with your own system? Your restaurant is the only one who didn't do their part here...I ordered, the driver went to pick up, the restaurant (you) didn't make the food.
author: Christopher T.

description: I had the yellow curry. It was good but way overpriced for the portion. Also they charge $2.50 for a can of soda which is highway robbery in my opinion. I never got the water I asked for. Even though I ordered my curry to be extra extra extra spicy, I'm pretty sure a dash of black pepper would have made more spicy than it was when it got to me. Also, by the time I left I was the only person. In the place and I still wasn't getting any attention from the waitress. I wouldn't waste my money here if I were you.
author: Larry S.

description: This is a great find for a hole in the wall resteraunt with home cooked Thai food.
author: Fateh S.

description: Nice little hole in the wall. Ordered takeout and had the pad see ew which came with lots of fresh veggies. Not much chicken but since it was a bit dry anyway it wasn't a big deal. Overall the dish was good and service was friendly. It was almost empty during dinner time but I suspect this place is much busier during lunch hour. Great little place if you're just looking for something super casual.
author: Debbie L.

description: Do you appreciate getting phone calls and being yelled at by a lady named Jin? If so, you have ordered from the right place. Not will she not understand what she is doing, but she will yell at you for answering your phone. Rude service and likely even worse food.
author: Jillian M.

description: Ordered takeout through uber eats one night and it took almost an hour and a half to arrive. To make matters worse, I had the grilled salmon and mango sticky rice, and unfortunately got sick from it :( I wanted to like this place, but probably won't be ordering from here ever again.
author: Alice S.

description:
Ordered delivery on Eat24 (free delivery in SF w/$15 min purchase, awesome) and it came in 23 minutes (wow, fast!!!) hot and fresh despite the Eat24 app listing 45-60 minutes. That's the best feeling when it comes fast.

The spicy shrimp pad thai ($9) is great. Perfectly cooked noodles, great fresh shrimp, big fan, yum!!

The $8ish beef noodle soup is solid. The differing cuts of brisket and flank steak were delish, but the broth was too simple and didn't have a deep depth of bone broth or saltiness to it. Probably will try diff soups next time.

Either way, great experience for delivery/pickup on Eat24 with extremely fast delivery and good food.
author: Chuck N.

description: Worst delivery service. Do not order from this restaurant. Have been waiting for almost 2 hours and all they said was the food is on its way in 10min. The food was cold when delivered.  The egg rolls were the worst.
author: jinyoung o.

description: I just discovered this Thai place by my work, and although the pad Thai tasted amazing, the service is horrible. I ordered over the phone for Pad Thai with shrimp. I went to pick up my order, went back to work and started eating, and realized it was tofu not shrimp. I called the restaurant at least 10 times, no answer. After over an hour, I got ahold of them and they said if I brought back the other meal, they would give me a Shrimp Pad Thai for free. First of all, you messed up on my order, I should get a free order regardless. Secondly, they told me the order would be ready in 20 minutes. When I arrived 40 minutes later, I had to sit and wait 20 minutes. If i did not work walking distance from this place, this would have been a MUCH larger inconvenience than it was.
author: Bella C.

description: One of the best Thai places I've been to. Very hole in the wall, but the people working there are fantastic and the food is delicious.
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Best Thai food I've had in the city in a VERY long time.

Duck Soup, broth was amazing.
Angel wings, all the way enclosed and crispy.
Green curry, my favorite dish.

Service was very good as well!
author: Zoe M.

description: Small portions (2 dishes needed per person), long delivery time (+1h), incomplete delivery
author: Charles-Louis V.

description:
I opened my Eat24 app to find this is the only Thai restaurant that delivers to my house, so I decided to give it a try. I ordered Thai Basil with Chicken, Pad See Ew with beef, and Penang Curry with pork. Although the pad see ew I'm familiar with has more sweet soy sauce and is darker in color, everything tasted delicious. 

What stood out for me, though, was the service. I ordered from their dinner menu so most items were a la cart and doesn't come with rice. No biggie, I have a rice cooker at home and can save a couple bucks. To my surprise, the restaurant called me after 30 mins to make sure I knew my orders didn't come with rice and if I wanted to add it to my delivery. I confirmed that I didn't want it and 10 mins later, they arrived at my door ahead of the estimated time on Eat24. I thought the restaurant was very considerate to call me because I can imagine some might be disappointed to find they didn't have rice, especially to soak up the curry!
author: Irene W.

description: Amazing Vegetarian options. I continue to use MealPal because of this place. The food is very tasty. Food is cooked to the right amount. They have really good flavors.
author: Vineet S.

description: Though unassuming on the outside, this restaurant really shined in food quality. We had the Thai Spicy pan fried noodles and the Pad See Ew, and both were among the best we've had. The staff was kind and the food came out quickly. We will definitely make it our preferred spot for Thai food in SoMa. The taste and food quality beats a lot of more pretentious and higher priced options.
author: Michela P.

description: The food is pretty good, but the service is ridiculously slow and inconsistent. Orders take from 20-50 (!!!) minutes to come out, regardless of how busy they are. It once took them an extra 15 minutes to bring out rice; I'd nearly finished by then.  So, decent food but be prepared to blow your entire lunch hour waiting for it.
author: Gary A.

description:
Unfortunately, up until tonight this was my favorite Thai restaurant in Soma. Despite the many times they have messed up my girlfriend and my takeout orders, and made us walk back to have them remake it, we continued to go back. We eat there 3 times a week, if not more.
Last night we were there having our usual dinner, we had finished ordering, paid for the meal and sat down to wait for the food to be made. They came to our table and said they forgot to charge us for the $3 shrimp add-on. They asked if we had cash to pay for the shrimp, which we did not. We offered to either pay again with our card or not have the shrimp added to the meal. They declined the offer and said not to worry about it. We thought it strange that they even asked since they had already charged our card.
We returned again tonight, ordered our usual and when we received the bill they told us that they were going to charge us for the $3 shrimp that they forgot to charge us for from the previous night.
If this had been any other restaurant it wouldn't be a big deal, however with how many times they have messed up our orders, we have been incredibly gracious and always tipped them, even when we have had to walk back for them to fix our orders. It seems extremely petty to add the $3 shrimp a day later from their mistake. We were loyal, daily customers, but after tonight I will be very surprised if we return. SINCERELY DISAPPOINTED!!
author: Nate B.

description: This place is really slow and they add a 15% tip by default, there were only three people in our group.
author: Madhu J.

description:
Have been here for lunch many times and the food is always good ... the service, though ? Well, it can be hot and miss most admittedly. Today was a bit of a miss. The place was actually busy at noon, with only one young lady waiting on tables and take-out. Not sure how many cooks, but orders seemed to come out slowly - and the waitress would occasionally forget a drink order or leave a soup on the counter too long. Could definitely use a second person when busy. Still, the good was good as always - and we weren't in a hurry so all was good. Started with spring rolls and Tom Yum soup. The spring rolls were hot and crispy ... soup was orphaned for a while but was still steaming when delivered. The entrees showed up before soup and rolls were even half finished so they were not as hot as when delivered when we started on them. Timing is important here, but a wait staff needs to communicate with the kitchen and I think it was too much for the single person there today. I had Pad See Eu but subbed mock chicken for the meat (pricey at $3 additional, but as a veggie I do get tired of just tofu, so it's a nice treat - and I don't often find mock meats offered in places, either!  The Thai Spicy Pan Fried with flat rice noodles (think a lighter fun noodle) was a hit as well - both were large servings, and with spring rolls and soup we left sated and happy !  
Will be back, but have learned to expect a slow paced meal - at least until a two-person crew is brought in for lunch rush. Still, the number of people coming and going speak to the quality of the food and the overall service.
author: Mark K.

description:
Funky little hole in the wall with mediocre service and good food.  Love it!  This is exactly what I was hoping for.  Not quite as good as house of thai, but definitely passes muster.  I will be back!
I had basil chicken (gai krapow), and it was far better than most places I have had it at.  Good balance between salty and sweet, good combo of flavors.  The prik nam pla (fish sauce with chilis in it) was different than I am used to, having an orange soaking in it.  Added a nice extra dimension to the flavor!
author: Shaun K.

description:
I live less than 2 blocks from this place.  I've eaten here at least once every two to three weeks for the last four years.

The food is always good.  I'd say a 3rd of the time I meet a friend there and not once has anyone had anything but praise for the food.  

I'm super finicky about the quality of broth used in soups and this place has a consistently delicious stock for the wonton soup.  It's so good, I often ask for just a container of plain broth to go if I'm under the weather.

This place is a small hole in the wall with one wait person staffed at any given time.  If you are a stickler for time, I suggest you arrive in off hours or be the early bird, especially for lunch.  As this neighborhood is still gentrifying, it always seems busier and busier.
author: Robert L.

description:
Little Thai restaurant in SOMA. Friendly staff, but the food was only okay. I had the rad nah ($10.95)- flat rice noodles with chicken and veggies in gravy sauce. The portions were generous, but the gravy was too thin so it was like noodle soup. The noodles stood up surprisingly well even being drowned in broth. The chicken was pretty tough, as expected in most Thai restaurant dishes. 

On MOGL (for cash back bonus).
author: Alice T.

description: I hate to diss a place without trying the food; but these guys had a lunch order for my company for about 2-3 hours and didn't even start working on it.  It would be fine if they'd just called and told us that they couldn't manage the order, but when we called to follow up they said it would take another hour to get it together.
author: Fiid W.

description: Came into town for work and promptly fell ill. I needed a chicken soup and rice and this restaurant did a great job. They delivered right on time. The food was hot and good. No complaints at all. Would love to try it next time in town once I feel better and try some pad thai or something with more spice.
author: Preston L.

description: A great hole in the wall kind of place. A very relaxed atmosphere, great happy staff. Service can be slow sometimes but food is really good here. Being close to work, we eat here more often & they have never disappointed in terms of food quality. Wait times can be painful sometimes during lunch hours but I'll rather work late than eat some place else.
author: Vipul Z.

description: Love this place, been eating here for years; mostly take-out but have dined in a few times too. Great food, reasonable prices, very courteous employees. I'll be a customer for life. Thai Hot Basil with chicken is my mainstay dish here these days, it's spicy and really tasty.
author: Marc E.

description: Walked in, ordered a lunch dish for takeout. I waited 35 minutes. No food, no acknowledgment by the employees for my long wait time. I had to leave to get back to work. They can keep my money. I wont be back.
author: Micah E.

description: The restaurant is not big. The environment is OK. The waitress is nice but they serve the dishes so slowly. We wait for a long time. They offer all kinds of Thai food, such as all kinds of appetizers, noodles, curry and desserts. We ordered pad Thai with shrimp and crispy calamari with sweet and sour sauce inside. Pad Thai is a little too sweet. Crispy calamari is very delicious.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Despite all of the negative reviews on yelp I decided to give this place a shot, and I had a really nice meal. 

It's a tiny restaurant with no frills, mishmash of decor, and old furniture. The food was yummy though. I would recommend this place for a meal if you're not looking for anything fancy. 

I ordered the roast duck over veggie - protein and veggies, just was I was craving. I asked for honey on the side, and didn't need to use any of it. 

We also ordered the tom ka kai coconut soup. Really yummy highly recommend it. 

Boy ordered the pad see ew with chicken, spicy. It was delicious and had a nice kick to it. I like that it's more Thai style, and not very sweet. 

For dessert we got mango sticky rice and it really hit the spot. Mango was just perfectly ripe. 

I didn't have any issues with wait time but then again, we dined at 9pm so they only had one other diner to attend to as well as deliveries. 

They're open until 10pm which is later than most in the area.
author: Jenn L.

description:
As much as I love the food here at chili lemon garlic, I have encounter not only once but twice HORRIBLE costumer service. 
I don't work too far from Bryant st. Literally right behind it. 
The first time I had ever call to place an order after I had tried it with my co workers. 
I called to place an order before my lunch, and who ever spoke with me on the phone told me that they couldn't take our order to call back later because they were busy. 
Uhmmmm I'm my head I'm thinking why would I call back later when I'm not going in right now I'm calling ahead of time for my food to be made!!! After I told the person why do I have to call back if I  want food now. She ended up taking my order after I had to nag why I had to call back later ! 
Really inconsiderate!!! 
Second time which is TODAY! I called the to place an order and their phone IS OFF !!!!! 
WTF !!!!! 
Probably not ever going here again since the services is ridiculous
author: Jess A.

description:
The storefront is pretty small, but I prefer the coziness of this restaurant over Koh Samui & The Monkey a block away. 

You can save 5% if you pay by cash, but my shrimp pad thai still comes out to be a little over $10. Nothing too special about the Pad Thai, but it is a little bit on the greasy side. I do like that this restaurant is right across the street from me so it's convenient if I'm craving Thai food. I just need to call in to place my order and pick up in ten minutes!
author: Christine S.

description: The server @ lunch is the best.  He is kind, attentive, helpful.  Food is good.  The location is quite good too.  This is a good hole-in-the-wall type of place you could frequent every week.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Since my first review, I've been back at least a dozen times between 2011-2012 and changed my mind. I credit that to my previous place of work being so close to Chili Lemon Garlic, giving me the chance to try a few other dishes.

My Favorite Diet-Friendly Flavor-Filled Lunch:
            * PLA GOONG (SALAD) - [4.5/5 - A large amount of perfectly cooked prawns, mixed with green salad, lemongrass, onions, hot chili, mint leaves with lime dressing. Very spicy when you ask for it.]

I'm not sure if they've changed their chef or just improved on their recipes a bit, but they now offer solid food that's consistently tasty, spicy when you ask for it, and extremely affordable.
author: Asha S.

description: I had the Thai hot basil rice plate with pork (my personal yardstick for first impressions of a Thai restaurant) and it was all I could ask: fresh, hot, and prompt. It was decently spicy just in the default version (without asking for extra spicy) which is another good indicator. I'll be back.
author: James P.

description:
This place was just OK. 

You don't come here because your taste buds are begging for the next foodgasm. You come here because it's late, your party is drunk, and you're too smashed to use a mobile device to consider alternatives. 

I had something w/noodles, or maybe rice..? Who knows, but it made me less drunk and for that, they get 3 stars.
author: Marcela H.

description: I literally like/eat everything and ordered the green curry from this place. It was so putrid I had to return it. It was watery and tasted rotten and like bananas. DO NOT order from here. EVER. This place needs to be shut down.
author: Caleb W.

description:
Noodle soup was ok -- should have gone rare beef, the regular beef tasted like pot roast, which wasn't what I was looking for. Spring rolls were decent (overpriced), green mussels were decent. Pineapple rice with chicken was a ton of food. Vegetarian meat was interestingly tasty.

Good place for a cold blustery day.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Way Overpriced and way under quality for the area.

Went with a large group for lunch. Ingredients were obviously not fresh, there was only one cook working so the food came out at different times, and tastes were bland at best.
author: Michael H.

description: San Francisco seems to feature a Thai restaurant on every corner. This was the restaurant I happened to be near at lunchtime. The place is tiny and quickly filled. The prices were reasonable, even cheap. I had the best Pad Thai I have had for a long time. Decor is nicely done, although the small size forced a certain clutter. Service was very good.
author: John S.

description:
Four words. Hair in my food.

This review is based on a delivery order. Delivery was prompt, but first thing I noticed was a lack of utensils, napkins, or condiments. The bag only had two containers for the two dishes I ordered. Second thing I noticed was that there was no rice with my beef curry. If it's unusual to have rice with thai curry, then maybe I've been spoiled. But I've NEVER been served curry without rice from any thai restaurant I've been to in my whole life. Third thing, the shrimp pad thai was very mediocre. Noodles were burnt and stuck together and there were only 4 small pieces of shrimp. The unappetizing cherry on top was a long strand of light brown hair wrapped around a piece of noodle.

First and last time trying this place.
author: Will Z.

description:
I never thought I'd be challenged to a fight over delivery food, but that's what you might get if you order from Chili Lemon Garlic. Bunch of punks with no care towards your food or your order.

We ordered a modest amount of food on a Sunday night at 8pm. At 9pm we wondered how long we'd have to wait, so we called and asked and they said they'd be sending it out soon. 10pm comes along and we're still waiting, so we call again, and they tell us it'll be sent out soon.  Really? So I called back and told them we'd rather not have them deliver the food. The guy on the other end of the line tells us that's it's already been sent out, so I ask if they'd like to give us a discount on the bill. He tells me he'll give us some free rice and cokes.

But wait, it's already been sent so how can we get free rice or cokes? Either he's lying about giving us free cokes or rice (neither of which we want) or he's lying about the order having been sent out. Shady either way, and I want none of their food. They're shady as hell and I told them as much after I confronted him about his lie.

Half an hour later, after we've already ordered food from a more reputable Thai restaurant, the delivery driver for Chili Lemon Garlic shows up at our door. I tell him we've already canceled our order after waiting 2.5 hours. The driver, in a huff, asks if I was the one who canceled the order and asks if I'd like to step out to fight him.

He wants to fight me.

No, I'd rather order food from a legitimate business that takes service seriously. If you want good food, delivered to you without an attitude, then you're ordering from the wrong place. The only thing going for them is that seamless advertises their business. And if seamless cares about customer satisfaction, they'll stop advertising for this terrible business.
author: Elliot E.

description:
A frequenter to this place and i love the food !!
what i like - 
1. panang curry
2. pumpkin curry
3. spicy catfish
4. thai spicy pan fried noodles
author: Ujwal U.

description:
First off, this place should be labeled as $$$ NOT $$. One appetizer dish is $7.50 (and this was a order of fried spring rolls! **shocked face**). Why is one appetizer dish the same price as a main dish?! RIDICULOUS! 

Second, the service kinda sucks. We came in, sat down, and 5 mins we were ready to order. Waitress didn't come for another 5 mins and this was after giving her numerous eye contact to let her know we were ready (note: there was only three other tables in this small place and most of them were eating or finishing their food... so she wasn't that busy). Finally, she came to our table and took our order. I ordered the Thai Boat noodle soup (close to $8). My co-worker ordered Seafood noodle soup (also close to $8) and we shared an appetizer. He asked the waitress which dish was better, angel wings or fried spring rolls... she said spring rolls and so we ordered that. 

I was getting over a cold and needed water to drink, so I asked her for water. Water did not come till 20mins AFTER we had sat down. Our appetizer came BEFORE I got my water! You should have seen my face.... I was NOT happy. 

I started eating the spring rolls.... it seriously was meh, nothing special about them to be worth $8 bucks. I did have their Angel Wings at this place before, and that was good. I should have made my co-worker order angel wings, way WAYY WAYYY better than the fried spring rolls we got. 

Then my noodle soup came out, and I was even more disappointed. The small bowl of noodles for $8, ARE YOU KiDDING ME?! If there was pho place close to my work, I know for a fact, I can get a extra large sized bowl for $8 bucks topped with hella meat and veggies! 

Thai boat noodle soup: Rice noodles and special combo of slices rare beef, beef stew, beef balls in spicy soup. It was not spicy, it was just very rich and very sweet. I had to add chili paste to make it spicy and even that didn't help dull the sweetness. This dish was really rich in beef broth, noodles were not over or under cooked, but when you read the description of a dish, you expect that the description should live up to the actual dish. When it says spicy soup, I expect spicy soup... not sweet. It didn't even have a kick of spiciness to it.  The meat in this dish was not all that good. The chunks of beef cubes in my dish was way too dry and the meat balls tasted so fake. 

My co-worker's seafood noodle soup was sad. Everything in it was all imitation seafood pieces. Imitation crab meat, imitation fish balls, just imitation everything! Ok, there was one piece of real shrimp and one piece of real squid.. but that was about it.
author: Erica T.

description: Little discreet Thai restaurant in SOMA.  I was recovering from a cold so I opted for #35 which is the Thai Boat Noodle Soup consisting of rice noodles and a combo of various mammals.  I'd say it was surprisingly tasty despite my sickness.  It hit the spot rather well.  Overall, a decent place for SF workers in SOMA needing some Thai noodles.  Will update when I try the regular items.
author: Ronald L.

description: Ordered takeout from here. Delivered cold.  Everything was awful. I don't know what this was, but it is not like any Thai food I've ever had before. We threw everything in the trash.
author: Erin J.

description:
If suckiness could be quantified it would look like Chili Lemon Garlic.  

Why?  Well, I'm not going to waste my time or your time (like they do at CLG) writing what has already been said by others.  Just read the 1 and 2 star reviews and you'll know why this place sucks.
author: SF R.

description:
Okay, I don't know if there was MSG in the fried rice or a bunch of salt or what, but I was hyper all the rest of the night and into the next day, including all the way through work.

Funny how the three words in the name of the place are "chili", "lemon", and "garlic", yet I don't recall the dishes of anyone among my 7- or 8-person group tasting hot, sour, or bad-breathy. Maybe we didn't hit on their specialty entrees or something.

Either way, my fake meat real rice dish was satisfying, and we enjoyed conversation which at points included vocabulary lessons and karaoke tips from the workers. If / when I go back, I'll consciously try to pick something more CLG-ish flavorwise.
author: Dan B.

description: Not sure why people are hating on this place. Despite the bad reviews on yelp, I finally checked it out to see for myself. I ordered a shrimp pad thai to go. It was really good! I'll definitely be back and will try dining in next time.
author: suzanne l.

description:
I used to come here with John W as well.  I absolutely loved going here at first.  Hole in the wall places are what I love, however that usually means the food needs to be good.  At first it was, but by the last time we went, the Pad Thai tasted worse than that stuff you buy in the microwave section.  It truly was awful.  I dont know why the change, but things quickly went downhill.  I'm pretty sure John had the tea and I had the coffee but either way, that was our last time going there.  
What was once quite good, gone truly awful. :(
author: David G.

description: This was a delivery order. It was half an hour late, they sent one wrong dish, and what they did send was mostly terrible. Wife got Heavenly Prawns which were stuffed with some sort of fish paste (not listed on the menu) that smelled as bad as it tasted (which was really bad). I ordered Green Curry, but the closest menu item to what I got is Jungle Curry because it had green beans. The rest was a mish-mash of chicken, green peppers, and bamboo shoots. At least it was a green sauce. It was OK, but just barely. And, again, the WRONG thing! We ordered Spring Rolls for an appetizer and they were so oily my fingers are still sliding off the keys. Once with this place was more than enough for us. Won't go in to eat, won't order delivery again.
author: Steve K.

description:
Eh.  This place is just OK.  I had the takeout experience so I can't judge based off of atmosphere and service experienced.  the driver was really nice though.

The food came promptly and everything was nice and warm.  The Thai Iced tea had to be fake.  It tasted like syrup and there was not an ounce of dark tea that makes up a Thai Iced "Tea".  It didn't taste thick like a creamer was used so this must be some kind of packaged drink, poured to order.

The Pad See Eu and it was good, but nothing too special.  I think everyone is always hoping for the best Thai they've ever had and I can't judge based off of one dish but I've had fresher dishes. once again - take out, so maybe I don't have the full experience of eating in, but typically my Thai is to go and I've had better.  The sticky rice wasn't so sticky BUT CLG's one redeeming factor was there Peanut Sauce,  I didn't experience an oily peanut adventure that you so often do when ordering dipping sauces.  It seemed to be blended perfectly and tasted great. Maybe I should have just ordered that with a spoon...?
author: Kevin J.

description:
Ordered Chicken Noodle soup. SO ordered thai-spicy Pad See Eww with chicken.

I wanted the spicy noodle with chicken instead of beef but apparently everything is pre-mixed so the server gave me the chicken noodle soup and sriracha...

The thai-spicy Pad See Eww had a ton of bell peppers and was relatively hot.

Overall, the food, price and service is a-ok. I suppose if you are on your way to the ball park
author: Att A.

description: Great food, love the pineapple fried rice, service is kind of slow,  but great family owned Thai food. We come her for lunch all the time.
author: Sundeep B.

description: A truly authentic thai experience. Great food! Have been here twice so far.
author: Glenn L.

description: A small place with good food. I tried the thai chicken fried rice. However you need to wait a bit for your food.
author: Soumyava D.

description:
Just did delivery tonight and the food came in under 30 minutes, which is a big, big plus in my book. When I unwrapped everything and noticed that a dish was missing, I called them and even though they said they made it, they took my word on the situation and made and delivered another order to me. I appreciate the customer service.

We ordered 
Pad Thai - good flavor and consistency
Yellow Curry - good portion, just the right amount of spice and texture
BBQ Beef - nicely cooked, tender and juicy
Cashew Chicken - just ok, breast meat a tad dry
Thai basil Pork - spicy but good flavor
Larb with Pork - loved the spicy and sour flavor
Chicken Satay - nicely cooked but way small portion

So counting the food, service and delivery, I would have given 4 stars but they have 2 negatives going for them. ONE, the portions are way small. For example the chicken satay at most places are 5 skewers. Here it is three. All the other dishes, save the curry, were on the small size also. Now that in itself isn't such a big unless..... TWO, but they are expensive too. The satay was $7.50, all other main dishes were around $10. Most other Thai places with similar items would be in the $8 range. But I guess the soma district just likes to have higher prices.

So small portions and expensive (for what you get) equals minus one star. Still the quick delivery and tasty food means I'll be doing delivery again in a few weeks.
author: Dom L.

description:
I went to chili lemon garlic to get some take out for lunch. I ordered a pad see eu, and although the flavor was there, my god was it oily. I took one bite of the noodles and felt like I took a swig out of a bottle of KY jelly. 

I literally had to take some tissue papers and drain out the oil to make this dish even half way bearable. 

Otherwise, taste is there. But what good is that when it leaves you feeling like you just got out of a low-budget porn flick.
author: Maxwell C.

description: The pad thai was pretty tasty, a bit on the sweet side but perfect consistency and a good rich sauce with a nice sour taste.  it was expensive though, especially for the portion size -  I paid $9.75 for an incredibly small portion with maybe 3 small pieces of chicken.  I didn't mind as much since I'm trying to cut down on portion sizes...but at least they should lower the price.  A shame because it's on my way to school and otherwise would be very convenient.
author: Shinny L.

description:
Reading the reviews before mine, I can agree with issues about portion size and price, but when it comes to the food, which is my main concern since I go to restaurants to eat, I like it. The food here has Thai street style, it definitely reminded me of my trip to Thailand, getting blasted and find a stop to eat at 3 am. 

I ordered Kao Pad KaPow (ground chicken with basil and kafer) and a fried egg. Probably one of my favorite dishes of all time, and they do a great job of it here. 
It probably matches up to par with how my mom makes it, and Mama's cooking is difficult to beat.  

Really tight seating, nothing to jaw dropping when you walk in. Its much more difficult to grab a table with a large party. 

Service is difficult to deal with as well. I only see one server when I eat here, and one afternoon it was packed, and service of course was just off. Luckily I knew what I wanted so the first time the server came to greet me I just laid it all down. Food took a while to get out to me after that, but on the bright side, the chefs were helping out by bringing completed dishes out to tables. 

For now I am satisfied with the food here, but have yet to try other dishes.
author: Nye T.

description:
Wow.  Avoid this place like the plague.  I can't really speak to the quality of the food because they refused to serve me.

My coworkers and I tried to order food for pickup.  We paid through Betterworks and came to pick up our food, and they refused to serve us.  Unbelievable!  I waited an additional half an hour for our food to be ready (on top of the original time estimate of 1 hour), went to pick it up, and now I am still hungry.
author: Rick F.

description:
I like trying new places and though this was good to try once, I don't think I'll be coming back. 

Ordered: papaya salad, Tom ka soup, pad Thai, and golden curry. Nothing was horrible but nothing stood out either, pretty average/meh tasting food.
author: Emmie N.

description:
Food is bland, greasy, and overpriced.

I removed my original review after a co-owner got nasty with me and accused me of not knowing anything about how Thai food should taste. Well, no, I am not from Thailand nor do I even claim to be an expert, I just know I've gone to dozens of Thai restaurants and have had better food at all of them.

There are several other good Thai places nearby - please your taste buds, avoid harassment, and spend your money where it's appreciated by going to Koh Samui and the Monkey or O-zone. Or, if you prefer to get sick after you eat a bunch of grease, why not just go to McDonald's?

See his reply below - his bullying and harassment don't stop, even after I blocked him. And when you order something with an addition - in my case, veggies, you expect to have some in there. This guy is nuts.
author: Katherine R.

description:
Alright, sounds like you want my coworkers to confirm it. I'll see if I can get them to come and write reviews as well. I can't remember whether it was thai ice coffee or thai ice tea, I go back and forth.

Indeed, I wasn't expecting anyone to reply but I'm pleased that you did so I have an excuse to rant about your terrible restaurant further :) Normally I would have just left a bad review and moved on but since you decided that the way to handle a bad review was to publicly attack them and call them a liar I've taken a special interest.

Do you always handle criticism as such a schizoid? Do you treat all your customers like this?
author: John W.

description: Worst service EVER.  We called in at 12:30 to put in our order of a fried rice dish to go.  The girl said 30 mins (pretty long for fried rice but assume lunch rush), and we arrive promptly at 1:00.  She told us it is still cooking and will be ready shortly. As we waited, the dining room started to get filled.  We continue to wait and wait and the food started to come out for the people who dined in and arrived after us. I asked the waitress when our food will be ready and she said its up next to be cooked. Wait, how did we fall behind in the cooking queue?  I asked how long and she says it's quick, less then 5 mins.  15 mins later the food came out .  The fried rice is dry with very little flavoring.  There seems to be black seasoning that resembles pepper but taste more like burn chard off the wok. Will not be coming back.
author: Polo T.

description:
I'm not a local so I can't address the common complaint that CLG is too expensive. SF is more expensive than where I come from. I can comment on the quality of the food (excellent), the service (super friendly) and the decor (small but fine space).

Their Yen Ta Fo was delish and they were out of mussels, so I couldn't try their Hoy Opp. Two had phad thai and loved it.

I'd be a regular if I lived nearby.
author: Bob S.

description:
I rarely get take outs...but last night my friend and I were craving Thai food..

I called CLG as they were closest to me...and for a place that seemed to be hole in the wall..they were quite expensive. 

The food was decent..the spicy dishes were intense...the green curry was pretty good..

While the place is definitely a bit overpriced..it is still reasonable considering there aren't a lot of comparable choices in the SOMA area..
author: Mimi T.

description:
My wife loved the food and I thought it was very decent.
We had the coconut soup with chicken and it was delicious and had a little kick - one of the better versions I've had. I ordered the pineapple fried rice and it was good. My wife ordered eggplant stuffed with shrimp on a bed of vegetables with a panang sauce and she adored it. I thought it was good and unique.
author: Marco M.

description: This place is tasty. The service is fast and efficient and the food is always great. I love their spring rolls (served in an adorable boat!) and their thai fried rice is fantastic.
author: Brandi V.

description:
I walked into this spot with high expectations from the decor and feel alone. Hadn't Yelped it, but went with a group of work peeps on a recommendation.

It's got that intimate little cafe feel that I prefer in my restaurants, not some hugeish room where you wonder if you'll ever see your server again. Some nice art pieces, cleverly painted, some mellow music.. yea, I though this was gonna be an aight' lunch.

Food wise it was lacking for me. I tried the lunch plate of "Spicy Eggplant", however I vote they rename it "Not Spicy At All Eggplant" for the sake of accuracy. The sauce was meh, so I ended up with my usual Thai food corrective action of dousing it in hot sauce. This is fine, I like hot sauce, but I'd prefer it if the flavor of the dish inspired me to leave it alone. If you've got to cover something in hot sauce or soy sauce or salt or whatever, then it's must not be that great. My co-workers seemed to dig the food, but I eat a lot of Thai food and I guess I was just hoping for a little more.

They have "lunch plate specials" so if you're near by and want to get your Thai on this place is fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Justin N.

description:
Super small portions is all I remember about this place. We ordered take-out and it was pricey for super small portions. Thai food for the most part is meant to be shared just like Chinese food. You can order a dish of pad thai and eat it all. But to enjoy all of what they have to offer it's best family-style. So maybe as a single serving portion it would be fine, but for family style we each had a small meager portion. 

I don't think our entrees had much meat in it like another reviewer stated. 

Disappointed, cute name for a thai restaurant though.
author: Grace L.

description:
I love ordering from here, from GrubHub.com. They have really great Panang Curry. It's creamy, full of flavour and packed with veggies and whatever else you choose to put in it. Their Pad Thai is pretty good! I liked their Pad See Ew, but I think the Pad Thai is better, but that's just me. This is actually a bit surprising because Pad See Ew is one of my fav dishes. 

The best is that I struggle to meet the $20 minimum for delivery. I order two dishes and then I have to get something extra in order to meet it. I tried the cucumber salad, which is the cheapest thing on the menu. I think that adding more expensive meats to your dish is the way to go. 

Their delivery usually arrives before the estimated time.
author: Mariko F.

description: the pad thai was greasey and burnt. the shrimp was bad and made me sick. never going again/
author: Amanda R.

description: I don't get it. Only 3 stars? Really? The herd mentality lately on Yelp is driving me crazy. I've wanted to eat here for a while and I finally got a co-worker to join me. We got the classic Thai minced chicken larb with khao niao (sticky rice) and a local favorite of late, shrimp pad see ew. The latter almost always tastes great with no exception here, so let me focus on the true test of Thai culinary skill, that of the spicy salads. Those who love them know, they are easy to mess up. An extra dab of fish sauce, too little garlic, even one missing ingredient and the whole dish is messed up. Let me say this place nailed it with their larb. All the ingredients were finally chopped and prepared with enough medium spiced sauce (not too wet, not too dry). The sticky rice and this sauce were outstanding. Most places serve this dish too dry, too sweet, too chewy, it always gets messed up. I was so happy to finally find a place that I would happily go back to. As with all Thai places, the only way to eat here is family style. God, I can't stand individualism at Thai places, each person with their own compartmentalized rice plate with minimal to no sharing. Ugh. That's not how it is supposed to be done. Anyhow, sorry 'bout my rant. 4 solid stars. Aroy mak mak!
author: Brian J.

description: I am giving CLG 5 stars to help inprove ratings. . The secert to this place is too order and pick up or have it delivered! The ambiance is very outdated, looks like a total "hole in the wall" as my father would call it, but the couple the runs the place are sincere, honest and friendly. We ate here on Labor date, and actual went in. Yes, if you eat there the portions are smaller, the price goes up and it is just another place in san fran, however after a long,busy day this is a great place to order some yellow curry, pad thai , chicken satay and have it delivered! And there thai iced is bomb!
author: ashley n.

description:
I decided to order from here through Eat24, despite all of the horrible reviews. I didn't feel like paying $20 for delivery from other places, so I chose this place because their minimum was lower. But I definitely should've paid the extra for another place.
After waiting over 2 and a half hours for the food to be delivered, it FINALLY arrived super cold and bland. I ordered vegetable pad thai(I don't eat meat), and it was incredibly dry & nothing special, although the spice was nice. Then when I was halfway through with the meal, I noticed there were tiny pieces of CHICKEN in it(at first I thought it was tofu, but it definitely wasn't) so I had to throw the rest of this mess in the trash, where it belonged.
I also ordered the cucumber salad to meet the delivery requirement, and it was okay, but the cucumbers were too small to enjoy the taste.
I really wouldn't recommend this place, even if you're desperate for some pad thai, especially after seeing the rude comments on here from the owner.
author: Kayla T.

description: Came here for a lunch date with the husband .  Thai fried rice was awesome .. Definitely want to come back and try some more of their food ..
author: Shilpa P.

description:
I really enjoyed this place! We came for dinner and were the only people in the restaurant (minus the couple that left right when we walked in). There was a stream of people coming for take-out orders, as well as the delivery driver coming back and forth.

Anyway, we ordered the string bean dish (with tofu), thai spicy pan fried noodles, and a thai iced tea. The two entrees, while a little heavy on the oil, were delicious! Very well spiced and balanced. The portions were also good - not oustanding, but standard. I wonder if the delivery portions are smaller, based on some of these reviews...

Service was also good, given we were the only people in the restaurant. In reality, this is probably closer to a 3.5* review... but hell, they've gotten panned in a few of the reviews, and I liked my experience, so I'll round up.
author: Rohan N.

description:
Good food and nice staff, but...

1. Small portions. For what we paid, I should've just gone to Koh Samui or Osha a few blocks away for more ambiance and presentation. 

2. I ordered soup and was asked if I wanted steamed or brown rice. I thought this came with it, so I ordered brown rice. I found out it was an additional charge after we got our check. It would have been nice to know that it was additional charge because I would have still enjoyed my soup without rice.

3. The significant other ordered noodles with "choice of meat". He ordered shrimp and nowhere on the menu did it say it was an additional $3. But we found that out after we got our check. The server could have said that it was an additional $3, like at other places.

Yeah yeah, WHINE and dine, but these little things go a long way. While eating, we thought we had found a new Thai spot to frequent in the neighborhood, but don't think we'd be coming back again. Had we known about these additional charges when we ordered, it would have changed our thoughts about this place.
author: Zell C.

description:
Good thai food.

We ordered:
-Cashew Tofu - The tofu was a bit hard but the rest of the veggies (onions, bell peppers, carrots) and cashews were good
-Pineapple Fried Rice (with egg) - I don't really like egg but I couldn't taste the egg in this dish which was good. A lot of dishes that contain egg only taste like egg. 
-Thai Spicy Pan Fried Noodles - Good! A little oily. 

My friends also ordered green papaya salad and tom yum soup before I got there and enjoyed both dishes. 

One comment - The bill we got was written in Thai so we had to go up to the counter to figure out what we had actually ordered!
author: Geetanjali J.

description: Longest. Wait. Ever. Place is next to empty and each person has to wait at least 30 minutes. Not worth it.
author: Joel L.

description: Thai restaurants in SF seem to have their act together when it comes to getting the flavors right. I loved the food here and their shrimp pad thai was delicious. The prices are good and the presentation for delivery items is great. The crab fried rice and chicken red curry were also winners in my book. I'll need to come back here and try the restaurant out in person.
author: Shali N.

description:
Thai food might as well be my kryptonite and craving it one day for lunch at work, I came across Chili Lemon Garlic. 

Everything I've tried here has been pretty good. I've had the Pad See Ew, which is my favorite. And when I'm craving the noodle soup, the Chicken noodle soup and the Beef Stew noodle soup are my go to choice. 

Prices are ok for the area I'm in, compared to other thai places around. The place gets crowded during lunch so go there early or do take out (which is what I do).
author: Lang T.

description:
Good Thai place tucked away randomly on Bryant Street. This place is not far from my work so I ocassionally go at lunch with some coworkers. This place fills up fast and is not very big so go at or before noon and don't go if you have a 1PM meeting. :)

Everything I've tried here has been good! Their pad thai is AWESOME which is sometimes rare at SF thai restaurants. Theirs is the right amount of flavorful and tastes delicious.

My other go to here is the pineapple fried rice. Very good. Comes with both chicken and shrimp unless you specify.

The curry is very good as well, but kind of a small portion compared to a lot of other similar places in the city where you get two meals' worth of food for the same price.

That being said, I like the feel of this place. Somewhat hole-in-the-wall yet classy enough. Good thai iced tea. 

Worth a visit.
author: Courtney A.

description: The worst service I have ever experienced. The delivery guy took 90 minutes to get here (without letting me know he would be late) and then had no change for me. When I called the restaurant, they did not seem to care and only stated it was the delivery guy's fault for taking so long. If you're going to have bad service, at least take responsibility for it
author: Najm H.

description:
This was quite possibly some of the most expensive Thai food I've ever ordered.  The appetizer I ordered was very good, but the noodle dish that I ordered left me very unsatisfied. 

I noticed this restaurant a few days ago situated about four and a half blocks from my workplace.  The restaurant is on Bryant Street near Third Street; that is a busy area for vehicular traffic but not pedestrian traffic.  Actually, it was the cool restaurant name that caught my attention.

On the afternoon that I visited there was only one other diner inside.  Given that specific location I wasn't surprised.  The waitress seated me and handed me a paper take-out menu.  I was surprised that they had no regular menus printed up.  The first thing I noticed was the higher than normal prices.  The waitress left me sitting there for quite some time before she returned to ask if I was ready to order.  I ordered the deep fried Shrimp Rolls and the Pad See Eu with chicken.  I asked for a glass of cold water.  The waitress brought me a fancy glass of water, but it wasn't cold.  It was room temperature.  I ordered a soda instead.  $2.00 for a 12 ounce can of soda!

The Shrimp Rolls (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/63brNArytTTX9Gi4cJjFqA?select=2iEkG65jUSqIQiPffcGVXw) arrived first served in a big porcelain boat with some sweet and sour dipping sauce and a small salad of iceberg lettuce and shredded carrots with a mildly sweet dressing.  The shrimp, each wrapped in an egg roll skin then deep fried, was perfectly cooked.  The dipping sauce was the perfect consistency, not too runny and not too thick.  I even liked the simple salad that accompanied the five rolls.

Next came the Pad See Eu (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/63brNArytTTX9Gi4cJjFqA?select=GLYm0oyujcJgZkU2VR1z5w), and I immediately noticed the ingredient substitution.  Instead of Chinese broccoli as specified in their own menu, I got American broccoli and thick squares of cabbage.  Neither vegetable was cooked thoroughly and both were hard and crunchy.  I'm used to nice big chunks of rice noodle, but the rice noodles were all broken up as if they had stuck to the pan and had to be scraped off.  By appearance I couldn't tell which was the noodle and which was the fried egg.  They also added crunchy carrots to the dish; that is another ingredient that was not printed on the menu.  The chicken pieces were white meat and very dry.  All of this combined in a sickening sweet, black soy sauce.  I love noodle dishes, and it is rare when I leave any of it behind, but I threw out half of CLG's Pad See Eu because it just didn't taste good.

Would the delicious, crunchy Shrimp Rolls bring me back for more?  Don't bet on it.  I'm sorry ... been there, done that!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Stopped by CLG for lunch today and they did a pretty good job authenticity-wise, and the food came fast. Service was good and attentive - and one server was attending to a full cafe of hungry patrons. Good flavoring - but I wish it was a tad bit spicier. San Francisco lacks a strong Thai joint, but this spot was a solid Thai place from what I've seen. 

Dined with a first-time Thai food eater so we stuck to the basics. We split several appetizers. First, we had the satay skewers and tom yum soup to start. They had an ample amount of peanut sauce that was very well-crafted on the chicken skewers. The Tom Yum could have been loaded with more vegetables, and was a bit on the bland side. The lemongrass and citrus came out, but there is certainly room for improvement. 

I had the pad see ew, and my friend had the chicken cashew rice dish. We were both very pleased with our entree selections. Pad see ew is not hard to mess up, and CLG did a great job with it. If they kicked up their flavors a notch, it would be a solid sell. It was simple, their menu was basic, but had all the traditional callings of a Thai place. Pricing was fair, and the staff was actually Thai (a good sign). The server was very busy, but very sweet. Will go back for more.

They also deliver, do take-out and their is Wi-Fi.
author: Tammy H.

description: I don't know why the fake chicken tastes so unfavorable but after two times trying it I am officially giving up. Not to mention they charged me $3 to put it in a dish that has "choice of meat" in the description. Which means they charged me $10 for a plate of rice fried in soy sauce and then $3 for fake meat. Booooo
author: Ryan G.

description: Wow! They just raised their prices! I paid $10.95 for a portion of Pad See-Ew for take out. That price, to me, is insane. I've been a customer here for many years and the food is always fine, serviceable, nothing groundbreaking- and that was fine when it was affordable. I will not - 100% - be back.
author: Greg W.

description:
let me explain the three stars... 

i came here last night after the game... ok, game ended early... but i also stopped by elsewhere for drinks... so at 9:50pm... i really wanted food... so since this was near by and my friend told me they had thai boat noodle... i decided to try this out.

the noodle was ok... the soup was sorta bland at first taste... but then i added more chili flakes and it tasted a lot better.... the noodle portion was decent, but it wasn't the best bowl of thai boat noodle i've had in the city...  the beef brisket and steak in the noodle soup was horrible... it was tough and chewy... to me, that's just inedible... had to leave it all in the bowl.... so really, food was more of a 2 STAR... 

the extra star is for their service... they were gonna close at 10pm... and we got there 10 minutes before they closed... there was no one eating... so i felt kinda bad that they were about to close... they staff was still happy to serve us, so thanks for that.... 

hmm... but other than that... i think this adds to my ONE and DONE list...  better bowl noodles out there to be devoured.
author: Kelly H.

description: I really liked this place at first. It had that hole-in-the-wall feeling, and the food was okay. We used to come here for lunch (our office was close by). However, with time the food got worse and worse. Last time we came, I could barely eat it. Also, my co-worker John W got some bad looking milk in his Thai Iced Tea/Coffee (who remembers). Anyway, it's a bummer they stopped caring about their quality of food. I can only hope they take the bad reviews to heart and improve.
author: Greg L.

description: Since my first review in 2011, I've visited this restaurant several times, each time being before attending a Giants evening ballgame. I'm improving my rating here because this year I've gotten pretty fast service each visit, even though the kitchen may have been preparing delivery orders at the same time (something explained to me by the owner when he reached out and sent a message to me after my original review). On top of that, I've gotten to enjoy their spicy beef stew noodle soup very much.
author: H K.

description:
A little hole in the wall place with decent Thai food...ok for lunch, probably better for delivery.

We all ordered the Tom Kar soup (I got veggie, the others had it with chicken), some rice and some fried coconut calamari. Everything was a-ok. Definitely filling. For soup, split calamari, thai ice tea, and service it was $20 each, a little pricey but given the SOMA location I guess it's the norm. 

Thai food isn't my absolute favorite, so I guess I'm a tougher critic when it comes to being excited over an average plate of Thai food. But the place was crowded (as it seems every food-serving place is during lunchtime mid-week in SOMA) so it sees like they are doing alright.
author: Kelly R.

description: Service is super slow. For a pad Thai, I waited for. 45 mins have a long walk back to work. Didn't eat lunch at all. Will not come back here anymore.
author: Pinky N.

description:
So. I like the food at Chili Lemon Garlic but I feel that the delivery service needs to improve. I place an order for delivery and then receive a phone call requesting that I go *pick up*  my delivery with the driver at the corner. 

This has happened on more than one occasion.
author: Fern P.

description:
This place moved from their 24th St location to SOMA and I'm so happy to have another option for Thai food!  The Thai eateries around the area (Koh Samui and Osha) has got the fancier vibe down, but it's nice to see CLG move into the hood because it means a more casual option for Thai.  

The service last night was slow, but very nice.  The food was delicious, but their Tom Yum soup missed the mark.  Plus, it was a buck or two more expense than I thought it would be.  Overall, the food here is decent, you can order for take out,  and having the brown rice option is great.  I think I'll be back to try more of their dishes!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
I love this place. Love it. I typically get delivery.

My favs: 
Pad Thai- no tofu
Pa Naang Chicken- no zucchini
Egg Rolls
Chicken Satay

The flavor on the Pa Naang Chicken (red chicken curry) is simply the most amazing flavor of any curry I have ever had, every single time. The rest of the food is always solid, but it's the curry (which also happens to be my favorite dish), that brings me back night after night.

To be honest, I'm a creature of habit, so I can't say that I've tried too many other dishes, even though I've ordered from here literally dozens upon dozens of times. Maybe I'll work on that... in the mean time, Pa Naang Chicken, to go please!! :)
author: Ashley J.

description:
My office ordered food from them for lunch to be picked up at 1:30pm (40 minutes after order). We got a call pushing that back to 2pm. When I showed up at 2:05pm, I was told that they weren't even going to try to fulfill the order and had no intention of doing anything about it. They were completely unapologetic.

The only reason I would ever return is to urinate on their doorstep.

*edit, in reply to Ricky V.*

Truth? Your restaurant took the order, requested more time, then refused to bother with serving us. Had you just rejected it outright, I and my co-workers would not have had to wait that extra hour to have lunch. Sure, I was being hyperbolic by making the urination comment, but a quick read of your reply reveals who the child is.
author: Alan R.

description: I've spotted this Thai restaurant a few times while visiting Darwin Cafe, but never bite until earlier today. My coworker and I had just downloaded a new take-out and Chili Lemon Garlic was one of the closest locations. We thought, why not!? I ordered the Paw See Ew w/ beef, he ordered the Pad Thai w/ chicken. When we arrived to the restaurant, we learned that the take-out app had not been properly working with the restaurant, and the cashier was in overload mode. Uh oh! We waited, waited, and waited, and finally about 45 minutes after we placed the order the take-out was ready. Our thoughts - this better be the best Thai lunch. When we got back to the office, we were slightly disappointed. The food was ok, but there are plenty of other Thai restaurants in the area that do a better job. For $10, I would rather go elsewhere.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Yummy, but definitely not fast nor cheap. 

Service is slow and even slower when it's crowded. The only waitress there can forget your menu or drinks and is hard to flag down sometimes. Can get pretty bad at lunch.

Their thai teas are filled with ice whereas their water barely has any. No refills on the tea and warm water - not cool. 

The food is good, but you get only a bit of meat and veggies. The cook will pile on the noodles, sauce and oil though. The portions are small too. What you get inside looks the same as what you get to-go.

The place can be stuffy, hot and cramped. I had to ask for the door to be kept open. Also on a particular day, the kitchen was spewing out lots of smoke. It got hard to breathe at one point.

No, I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend. Slow service and cook. Stuffy and cramped. Small, skimpy portions and watered down drinks.
author: Erin D.

description:
Out of laziness I ordered delivery from this place a few days ago since the menu found it's way onto my fridge. I was considering getting Ozone, but thought I'd try somewhere else that was comparable in cost.

Got the green curry and spicy eggplant, which is basically what I usually order when I go to any Thai restaurant. No, I'm not a Thai food expert, but I do eat Thai a decent amount, and I do know what good food tastes like.

In short, this was not good food. My main complaints were that the rice was really overcooked and the chicken tasted like it had been frozen and reheated (freezer burn mmmmmm). However, the flavor of the curry wasn't bad, so I ate the sauce, parts of the rice that were still individual rice pieces (not congealed globs of rice-like matter) and picked the rubbery eggplant out.

Pretty disappointing. But if you are looking for green curry soup without chicken, highly recommended!
author: Lissa K.

description:
we ordered online and it took 2 hours to arrive.  

the food was meh and 3 spring rolls for $7.25?  gah!

never again.
author: Jen I.

description: Found out that one of the staff members took my boyfriend home one night after dinner. No joke. Classy.
author: Missy D.

description:
I had a pork-and-fried-noodle deal. My friend had the green curry. 

The food was a bit sweet, had a creamy texture, and the spice made sure that when you bit into the meat, it bit back. It had attitude. It was just the way I like it. 

Problem is: that was HIS dish, not mine. Yeah, he let me have a few bites, so shaddup. :P

His decision was clearly the better one.

Nothing was wrong with my food, but it had nothing on the curry. Not a thing.

Learn from my mistake: have the curry. Damn it.
author: Tim B.

description:
Great looking menu was excited to get the chef's special heavenly prawns and beef larb salad but after sitting there for a HALF HOUR with nothing but an empty water glass on the table the waitress comes up to me and informs me that my order will take too long to prepare so I need to switch to something more convenient. Already late for work our entrees come out after 45 minutes of sitting there. I just assumed she forgot the salad but no it comes out after our entrees. Never once filled up our water glass in the entire 1:15 minutes we were there. 

Someone please tell that waitress that salad comes before entree and that if water glass is empty fill it! Someone tell that owner that if something takes too long to make don't put it on the menu and if you want me to switch my order do it when I order not a half hour after I've been sitting there with an empty water glass. 

Never again too bad cause food wasn't bad.

if you do eat here I highly suggest take out then pick it up 15 minutes after they tell you.
author: Rob O.

description:
This Thai restaurant replaces an excellent Malaysian restaurant and just doesn't live up to the predecessor. Highlights: Crab fried rice. Mmmm it's so good. Overall its decent but not something to write home about. More of an every-day place. 

The real problem is the thai competition in the area. There's Osha (4th&folsome), Ozone (2nd&Brannan) and Koh Samui(3rd&Brannan).
author: Brandon O.

description: Just an Ok....pretty boring and nothing memorable. Just another mediocre eatery...
author: Xela H.

description:
I found this place by using the Urban spoon App. that stated that it had 93% approval, so i figured i give it a try. I'm not sure what these people are thinking by approving this place. I don't normally rate places to eat bad since i love food but this was bad. 

So i tried to go there for my lunch break which is only 30 minutes. I called ahead of time for the Thai BBQ chicken over rice. When i get there the lady tells me she doesn't have my order. So i order it to go. I then wait for 30 minutes to get my food. At this same time all the people that arrived after me got there food before me who were not to go orders??? On top of this there was a group of 7 people that came in and i had to stand up so that they could sit down since the place is very small. I then receive my food for $10.00 and it is just a 1/2 chicken breast over rice. WTF!? So it took half an hour to cook a little piece of chicken with rice that was precooked??? 

So basically i was late going back to work from lunch with a lunch that tasted like regular chicken (no special seasoning) that I finished off in 4 bites...
author: DAVID L.

description:
I think this place does just alright.  I love Thai food and for delivery standards, this'll do.  I ordered the pad thai with shrimp, which was a bit of a disappointment.  There wasn't much flavor or color.  But, for cheap delivery, what can you expect?  'Wish they added a lemon or lime to the entree!

I also ordered the yellow curry with the chicken, which I thought was pretty good.  The chicken chunks though were thin and could be bigger.  But, the curry sauce made up for it.

I'm sure there are better Thai places in the city, but if I feel like ordering in and want to keep it cheap, this'll do for now.
author: Christine E.

description:
Some Asian food establishments have service that would be considered "rude" or "pushy" by Western standards. For me, this can be part of their unique charm.  

However, one thing that no Asian restaurant has ever allowed to occur is for me to leave hungry. Yet this is exactly what happened tonight.

Out with some friends after a Cal football game, I ordered the chicken larb. I made a special point to request extra spicy and joked about it, so this dish should have been memorable to the server.

Later, without announcing the dish, the server delivered my plate of larb to my friend several seats away, and my friend, who didn't know the difference between dishes, began to devour it without saying anything. I also didn't notice because I wasn't sure what he had ordered.

After all the food was delivered and my plate was more than half eaten, the misdelivery became clear (we explained it in front of the server) and I was the only one at the table left with no food. 

Did the server apologize? No.
Did he offer to bring me another plate of larb? No.

I wanted to give him the chance to fix his mistake, and I saw him speaking with the kitchen staff, so I didn't say anything further. But in the  end, he brought nothing. 

To me, this indicated that he wasn't paying us any attention (even though we were the only patrons in the restaurant at the time), and that he just didn't care. 

Oh, and the larb? According to my friends, it wasn't spicy at all -- they were not sweating. For a place with "chili" in the name, this was a huge disappointment... 

Even though I live nearby, I won't be going back.
author: movinon ..

description:
this is a very typical soma restaurant catered to the soma crowd. 
food is ok, items are overpriced and portions are small.
not my top choice but due to the poor lack of good asian food in the area, theres not too many better options.
author: Alex H.

description: There's only one cook and one waitress so service is incredibly slow. I ordered takeout and waited almost half an hour for a very small platter of fried rice that was way overpriced at $10. The food was a bit greasy, but tasted good otherwise.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Meh. I've experienced MUCH better. 

Pad thai was pretty good, but green curry was pretty aweful - very runny, no flavor.
author: Yevi A.

description:
I enjoyed my spicy chicken soup(I forgot the name), but the utensils were dirty and I had we had to remind the waitress that we ordered two cokes...twice!
Other than that, it was good and I'd go again just for that soup, which was very tasty.
author: Mike Z.

description: One of the BEST and authentic Thai food in SF! Pineapple fried rice and Dancing Prawns a MUST!! Even though it's a small and humble place, it's worth a dine.
author: MeeSun B.

description: truly awful thai food. the penang curry was watery and clear - penang curry should never be clear!!
author: Rachel D.

description:
CLG is close to my office and is a GREAT alternative to Koh Samui/The Monkey. 

The website to order online definitely needs some updating. They don't deliver for lunch. 

The duck noodle soup is perfect on a cold day and seasoned very well. I usually get the Pad See Ew without carrots and they're very accommodating. Service is fine, price is fine, food is great
author: Tien H.

description: Horribly slow, I should have ordered my "to go" for an hour prep time.  All I ordered was ginger chicken, and it was as if "fresh and easy" packaged it.  The next time that I come here will be in a nightmare.
author: Dawud H.

description:
I walked into CLG a couple of months ago as I was scouring my new neighborhood for a Thai takeout place that could become a staple for those nights when I'm too busy to cook (read: too busy watching Rock of Love/Flavor of Love/Real Chance at Love/Tool Academy 2 to cook).  

"Cool," I thought as I walked in.  "A dumpy, cheap Thai takeout place, this is excellent."  Well, I was partially right-- dumpy it is, but cheap it ain't, with a small order of yellow chicken curry with brown rice running me more than $14.  When I first walked in I felt good that I was patronizing a smaller establishment that was clearly hurting for business (no one was in there, and the cashier was obviously excited to have some human interaction), but I can't justify going back when I know I could get decent Thai takeout for $8 or $9 somewhere else.  

Sorry, CLG, but I'm a cheap kinda girl, and I need some cheap kinda takeout.
author: Lauren S.

description:
In short, I will never order from or go to this restaurant again.  

It is close to my apt, so I was hoping for some good and easy take-out....very disappointing.  I called and ordered the shrimp rolls and BBQ beef for dinner.  The woman on the phone said it would be 30 mins because they were really busy.  I said fine, then she said "yes, it will be like 30 to 35 minutes".  I asked if I should try them some other night, but she insisted that it would be fine.  I arrived exactly 30 mins later and I see a half empty restaurant and a couple of to-go orders sitting on the counter...mine was in the back corner...bad sign.  I could tell the food was already cold...it was frigid when I got home 2 mins later (btw, they do not include rice with their entrees...what is up with that???).  I was starving, so I ate it...barely tolerable.  So sad...I will continue my hunt for a decent neighborhood place in SOMA.
author: Steve S.

description:
This place has some delicious vegetarian options, but over the past several months I've found myself defaulting to the cashew chicken (with fake chicken, of course).  My bf almost always gets the spicy Thai basil chicken (like the bird kind), and raves that it's always the right amount of spicy for him (which isn't the Falung 'spicy' either).

The service is always extremely warm and friendly.  Although the space is on the cozy size, they offer delivery service.  So, on those days that I'm too lazy to walk a few blocks to grab some Thai food, they help make life easier by bringing it to me.
author: Melissa M.

description:
So unimpressed it's ridiculous.  

Went here a couple weeks ago with some co-workers for lunch.  Despite the cheaper lunch specials, I paid $12 incl. tax+tip for bbq chicken fried rice.  Usually wouldn't be too much of a wallet-killer, except that the fried rice was really just rice drenched in soy sauce with a tiny bit of egg in it.  Pretty terrible.  Their flavor is derived from soy sauce.  Not cute.  Not in the least.

It's a shame since it's so close to my work and there aren't a ton of good Asian foods around.  I'll probably give it another shot and try one of their curries, but to be honest, my co-worker's curry didn't look too great either.  Try almost any Thai place in Berkeley.  It's better bang for your buck.
author: Jen C.

description: Remarkably, they'll substitute seitan for meat in just about anything they offer. The food is above average, but so are the prices--even before the vegetarian surcharge. The service runs hot and cold, often in the same visit. We'll see if this becomes my go-to Thai place at work.
author: Brian W.

description:
This is for DELIVERY.

I always get pad thai the first time I go to any Thai restaurant. I use it as a baseline, as I did at CLG. As stated in some reviews, it did lack flavor so I doused it with a couple teaspoons of peanut sauce (that I got from Osha a couple days ago) and a couple teaspoons of chili garlic sauce. After that, it was actually really decent. The chili garlic sauce also helped add more heat because I had ordered it HOT and it was more like a WPM (white-people-medium).

There is no additional charge for shrimp in the dish, which is rare, but there were only 4 pieces of small shrimp. So that was an acceptable trade-off.

I went on reviews and also got the crab fried rice which I don't think I've ever had before. It was very tasty.

They took my delivery order at 10 minutes before closing with no complaints, which normally I wouldn't be that person but this place is only a couple blocks from my house (I'm sick and didn't want to go outside). The delivery guy was very nice and it was very fast and hot. WOW, that sounds weird! I'll add that one to the bucket list.

So that's all I have for the food, I would give it 4 stars on food this time but I'm knocking it down to 3 for having to season the food myself.

Delivery was a 5 (that's what HE said). Overall value I'd go with a 4. Great for cheap delivery with a $20-ish minimum.
author: Hilarie S.
